how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: TW is my main information knowledge base, highly valued as it is self-controlled & so not reliant on an outside service and widely able to be accessed across multiple OSes / devices.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: My use is basic; I use TiddlyWiki in a configuration close to standard, without plugins
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox)

what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Compatibility with easy upgrading. Not particularly dogmaitc - for example integration of Markdown in the past etc.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Tiddlywiki preferred / endorsed / led / managed single file save solution for the various browsers - Firefox and those that include Manifest 2, Manifest 3 browsers etc.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
